articles.title: Average US long-term mortgage rate hits the lowest point in more than 3 years - AP News
articles.description: The average long-term U.S. mortgage rate is now down to its lowest level in more than three years. Mortgage buyer Freddie Mac said Thursday that the benchmark 30-year fixed rate mortgage rate eased to 6.06% this week, down from 6.16% last week. One year ago, …

articles.title: China’s $1.2 Trillion Windfall Quietly Seeps Into Global Markets - Bloomberg.com
articles.description: A record trade surplus racked up by China is washing up around the world, as export earnings that once ended up in state coffers instead fund massive private purchases of overseas securities and business expansion abroad.

articles.title: Rare earths magnets: How realistic are India's its ambitions? - BBC
articles.description: India has a $800m plan to make rare earth magnets, aiming to reduce dependence on Chinese imports - but can it work?

articles.title: Silver’s Rally Slams Solar Makers Struggling With Losses - Bloomberg.com
articles.description: Soaring prices for silver are putting an extra squeeze on solar panel makers as they look to end more than two years of losses amid brutal competition in the sector.

articles.title: Stock futures are little changed after rally in banks and tech lifts major averages: Live updates - CNBC
articles.description: Semiconductor and bank stocks helped lift the broad market higher on Thursday.

articles.title: Senators vow to revive crypto bill - Politico
articles.description: Lawmakers need to go back to the drawing board on a key sticking point to find a compromise that both banks and crypto firms can live with.

articles.title: Trump to Direct Key US Grid Operator to Hold Emergency Auction - Bloomberg.com
articles.description: President Donald Trump and the governors of several US Northeastern states agreed to push for an emergency wholesale electricity auction that would compel technology companies to effectively fund new power plants.

articles.title: Spotify raises prices as streaming costs pile up on Americans - Axios
articles.description: The music streaming service is raising the price of a premium subscription to $13 a month from $12 in the U.S.

articles.title: David Ellison Meets With UK Culture Secretary, Creatives As Paramount Takes WBD Lobbying Effort Across The Pond - Deadline
articles.description: Paramount CEO David Ellison this week met with UK Secretary of Culture Lisa Nandy as well as prominent European creatives.

articles.title: Judge hands offshore wind industry another victory against Trump in clearing way for NY project - ABC News
articles.description: A federal judge has cleared the way for a New York offshore wind project to resume construction

articles.title: Verizon outage today: Affected customers can claim $20 account credit. Here's how. - Mashable
articles.description: Log into the myVerizon app to claim.

articles.title: Trump Backs Credit Card Swipe Fee Crackdown—Why Rewards Get Cut and Fees Go Up - View from the Wing
articles.description: Trump has now endorsed the Durbin-Marshall swipe fee bill, pitching it as “competition” and consumer relief. In reality it shifts value from cardholders to retailers—cutting rewards, pushing issuers toward higher fees elsewhere, and shrinking credit availabil…

articles.title: College students and teens could be fueling the prediction markets boom - CNBC
articles.description: Where sports betting is legal, it's often limited to those 21 years or older. Kalshi and Polymarket are open to anyone 18 or older, with some exceptions.

articles.title: Behind Trump vs. Powell Is a Battle Over US Empire’s Future - Jacobin
articles.description: After the 2008 crisis, the US set up a vast financial network offering liquidity to its allies. The ongoing clash between Jerome Powell and Donald Trump is partly about the future of this system and which vision of American empire it will promote.

articles.title: The US imposes 25% tariff on Nvidia’s H200 AI chips headed to China - TechCrunch
articles.description: The Trump administration formalized its 25% cut of H200 chip sales in China with a tariff that applies to certain semiconductors.

articles.title: Lawsuit alleges Lilly, Novo locked up telehealth to kill compounded GLP-1s - Sherwood News
articles.description: Novo Nordisk CEO Mike Doustdar estimated that around 1.5 million US patients are using compounded versions of the company’s drugs.

articles.title: Boston Scientific to acquire Penumbra for $14.5B - MedTech Dive
articles.description: With the planned purchase, Boston Scientific will gain several thrombectomy devices to remove clots from blood vessels.

articles.title: Los Angeles Billionaire Moves To Nevada After California Threatens To Tax Wealth - Forbes
articles.description: Exclusive: The buyer behind a record $21 million Las Vegas-area penthouse is a lifelong California resident who says the state’s taxes have pushed him out: “I just felt a little bit like I wasn’t wanted.”

articles.title: TSMC’s Strong Outlook Fires Up Hopes of Sustained AI Boom - Yahoo Finance
